title: Therapeutic Drug Monitoring (TDM) Pharmacokinetic Principles: Interactive E-Learning Course

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Applying mobile-first design optimized for smartphone-based learning environments, combining real-time interaction and asynchronous learning in a blended education model.

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more definitions and clinical application cases of TDM (Therapeutic Drug Monitoring).
Learners can apply calculation methods for key pharmacokinetic parameters (e.g., half-life, clearance rate, volume of distribution) to analyze real-world cases.
Learners can present a decision-making process of five or more steps that considers individual patient variability when interpreting TDM results.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
